case_vignette: A 62-year-old man is brought to the physician by his wife for increased forgetfulness and unsteady gait over the past 3 months. He is a journalist and has had difficulty concentrating on his writing. He also complains of urinary urgency recently. His temperature is 36.8°C (98.2°F) and blood pressure is 139/83 mm Hg. He is oriented only to person and place. He is able to recall 2 out of 3 words immediately and 1 out of 3 after five minutes. He has a slow, broad-based gait and takes short steps. Neurological examination is otherwise normal. Urinalysis is normal.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing increased forgetfulness, unsteady walking, difficulty concentrating on my writing, and a sudden need to urinate more urgently.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
For the past 3 months.
Have you noticed any changes in your mood or behavior?
My wife might have noticed some changes, but I haven't really paid attention to changes in my mood or behavior.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently on any medication?
I can't provide any details on other medical conditions or medications as the case vignette doesn't mention any.
Have you ever had any head injury or neurosurgical procedure in the past?
The case vignette doesn't mention any past head injury or neurosurgical procedure.
Have any of your family members experienced similar symptoms or been diagnosed with neurological conditions?
I don't know, the case vignette doesn't provide information about my family's medical history.
May I know your age and sex?
I'm a 62-year-old man.
Final Diagnosis: Normal pressure hydrocephalus (NPH)
